StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: A Genome-Wide Association Study for Post-bronchodilator Lung Function in Children with Asthma

Person.Organization: BRIGHAM AND WOMEN'S HOSPITALUNIVERSITY OF PITTSBURGH AT PITTSBURGH

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: The Hartford-Puerto Rico study was supported by grant HL079966 from the U.S. National Institutes of Health (PI: Juan C. Celedón).
Policy.ic_specific_access_term: Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval. only full or expedited IRB approvals are accepted and study requires IRB annual review. Requestor agrees to make results of studies using the data available to the larger scientific community. Use of the data is limited to not-for-profit organizations. Use of the data includes methods development research (e.g., development of software or algorithms). Use of the data is limited to genetic studies only. Use of the data must be related to Asthma and related condition of post-bronchodilator lung function.

GSR_Access.gsr_mode_label: Controlled-access (GSR are sensitive according to the Institutional Certification)

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Asthma, IRB, PUB, NPU, MDS, GSO, RD)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-ASTHMA-IRB-PUB-NPU-MDS-GSO-RD
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction:
Use of the data must be related to Asthma and related disorders. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval. Requestor agrees to make results of studies using the data available to the larger scientific community. Use of the data is limited to not-for-profit organizations. Use of the data includes methods development research (e.g., development of software or algorithms). Use of the data is limited to genetic studies only.
Use of the data must be related to Asthma and related condition of post-bronchodilator lung function.
